Articles.Content:
Its a known bug, It is only the FX that is broken the engine still works. I swapped the values for LR-91 mini and the Bertha mini (Bertha is smaller but it had more thrust) and forgot to fix the FX placement. It will be fixed in the next release along with the Gemini landing gear bugs.

If its really bugging you open up the FASA_OrbitalBerthaEngine_Mini folder under GameData/FASA/Gemini2

Open up part.cfg with a text editor.

change

fxOffset = 0, 0, 25

to this

fxOffset = 0, 0, 0.25

Or just wait for the next update.

Edited January 14, 2014 by frizzank
I decided to use the transtage as a makeshift Centaur and go for a circum-Munar spin. It does a nifty job!
Awesome, looks good! I wish I could get the lights to tie into probe function, that would be a neat trick.
frizzank: shouldn't be hard to make a plugin that toggles lights based on if crew aboard >0 (if that's what you mean) or whatever other check you want.

Also, confirming the issue with the LR-91 mini is that its fxoffset is set to 25, not 0.25

EDIT: also duplicate textures for Gemini Pod and WingGemini (both png and tga)

Edited January 15, 2014 by NathanKell

So I got a chance to actually play KSP and I came up with this gem the other night.

Its Rescue Big G in a shuttle configuration with a makeshift docking bay (MOL equipment part).

It took a bit to figure out the engine configuration but once I did it flew rather well.

http://i.imgur.com/l3JWRuZ.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/xS7Cg23.jpg

That's great, I've wanted to try and lengthen that MOL bay myself, how do you do it?

That's great, I've wanted to try and lengthen that MOL bay myself, how do you do it?

Just stack multiple bays.

Also I cheated...

I wanted a longer bay so i made one that was separated from the end-caps. It is harder to place because the nodes are so close together on the caps so I left the original one in there for ease of use. I may make the multi stack one just open from the top so its a real bay but I kind of like the both sides opening.

Please do a version that can open only from one side. Maybe make it so that it there's two animations. One for one side and one for the other. Than you have a part that can both open together or separately.
Could you rename the nosecone walls so that they register with FAR? As of now, some fairings don't have neither "payload", "fairing" nor "shroud" in their name, making FAR not recognize them.

Could you rename the nosecone walls so that they register with FAR? As of now, some fairings don't have neither "payload", "fairing" nor "shroud" in their name, making FAR not recognize them.

He's said on multiple occasions that he will NOT add mod support.

He's said on multiple occasions that he will NOT add mod support.

I will fix bugs associated with them but I don't want to go down the path of making sure FASA is compatible with most mods. That would be a full time job in its self.

If I rename the parts it will break save games and craft files for those parts, and im not willing to do that just yet.

If its a big deal you can add the words to the names of the parts by editing the cfg files.

Edited January 15, 2014 by frizzank
Well, then. Just keep that in mind when the next save-breaking update rolls around. It's a small change, the only problem is that it breaks saves...
Why do the pods have multiple science containers btw? One can already hold an infinite amount of science I think.

frizzank: not part.name, part.title. That doesn't break saves (that's one reason why Ferram uses part title, not part name). In fact if you spelled out Payload Launch Fairing for the walls and nose, rather than abbreviating it, that would work.

Also: props on the shuttle. In point of fact that last pic looks like some of the concept art for Shuttle Agena (Lockheed's proposal to make a Shuttle-compatible Agena, like was done for IUS).

New Launch tower, much better than the old one.

The elevator doors at the top and bottom are hatch exits. Clicking on one of the doors and clicking EVA will eject you from the door you clicked on. So you could load all your Kerbals in at the bottom, Ride them to the top and load up your rocket, if you wanted to.

I made the Entry Platform big enough for 2m rockets. It's a tad big for Gemini but it's not bad.

The retracting walkway comes out far enough to put it on the side of the IIIC and not clip the boosters when it launches.

Next Im going to make the actual launch clamps that will go on the bottom of the rocket for a more realistic way to clamp down your rocket.

Then the umbilical for fuel and stuff.

*hurk* *SPLAT*

Great, now I need to clean my brain off my keyboard!

Honestly, that is a beautiful piece of work. Is there any chance of making a 1.25 meter version later, after the clamps and umbilicals are done?
*jaw drops * nice work frizzank
Wow, this is pretty amazing. It solves the problem falling off the edges that the previous version had and it just looks gorgeous.
New Launch tower, much better than the old one.

Is there any chance of making a 1.25 meter version later, after the clamps and umbilicals are done?

I am just going to half scale this one for a 1.25 meter version. The textures are larger than usual given how large it is and how it had to be constructed so I would get a re-use from the textures.

Also I am going to make the umbilical from the same textures so the overhead for the pack will be lower.

After I finish up these Im going to put out a release maybe sometime this weekend. It will have fixes and the new launch tower stuff.

After that I am going to start on Saturn IB parts. By the time I am done with the rocket parts, Denny should be done with the CSM and Lander.

Then Saturn V and bug fixing the previous release.

After that I would like to do some Apollo "What if" scenarios the same way I did for Gemini. There is a lot of great stuff in that line and it would be awesome to play with.
You just keep stunning me frizzank with your creations. Thank you Sir.

I am just going to half scale this one for a 1.25 meter version.

If it'll be possible will you make it compatible for the Saturn launch vehicles?
Wow Frizz, can't wait!

If it'll be possible will you make it compatible for the Saturn launch vehicles?

Yes but it will be Saturn V specific with a swing arm walkway instead of a retracting one.
